intro: Plantago lagopus f. melanocephala, commonly known as the black-headed plantain, is a variant of the common plantain. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a dark green upper surface and a lighter underside. Its flowers are small, greenish, and clustered in loose spikes, typical of the Plantaginaceae family. This form is distinguished by its darker, more prominent petioles and a unique blackish hue at the base of the leaf stalk.
